00022 /// @defgroup cpArbiter cpArbiter
00023 /// The cpArbiter struct controls pairs of colliding shapes.
00024 /// They are also used in conjuction with collision handler callbacks
00025 /// allowing you to retrieve information on the collision and control it.
00026 /// @{
00027 
00028 /// Collision begin event function callback type.
00029 /// Returning false from a begin callback causes the collision to be ignored until
00030 /// the the separate callback is called when the objects stop colliding.
00031 typedef cpBool (*cpCollisionBeginFunc)(cpArbiter *arb, cpSpace *space, void *data);
00032 /// Collision pre-solve event function callback type.
00033 /// Returning false from a pre-step callback causes the collision to be ignored until the next step.
00034 typedef cpBool (*cpCollisionPreSolveFunc)(cpArbiter *arb, cpSpace *space, void *data);
00035 /// Collision post-solve event function callback type.
00036 typedef void (*cpCollisionPostSolveFunc)(cpArbiter *arb, cpSpace *space, void *data);
00037 /// Collision separate event function callback type.
00038 typedef void (*cpCollisionSeparateFunc)(cpArbiter *arb, cpSpace *space, void *data);
00039 
00040 /// @private
00041 struct cpCollisionHandler {
00042         cpCollisionType a;
00043         cpCollisionType b;
00044         cpCollisionBeginFunc begin;
00045         cpCollisionPreSolveFunc preSolve;
00046         cpCollisionPostSolveFunc postSolve;
00047         cpCollisionSeparateFunc separate;
00048         void *data;
00049 };
00050 
00051 typedef struct cpContact cpContact;
00052 
00053 #define CP_MAX_CONTACTS_PER_ARBITER 4
00054 
00055 /// @private
00056 typedef enum cpArbiterState {
00057         // Arbiter is active and its the first collision.
00058         cpArbiterStateFirstColl,
00059         // Arbiter is active and its not the first collision.
00060         cpArbiterStateNormal,
00061         // Collision has been explicitly ignored.
00062         // Either by returning false from a begin collision handler or calling cpArbiterIgnore().
00063         cpArbiterStateIgnore,
00064         // Collison is no longer active. A space will cache an arbiter for up to cpSpace.collisionPersistence more steps.
00065         cpArbiterStateCached,
00066 } cpArbiterState;
00067 
00068 /// @private
00069 struct cpArbiterThread {
00070         // Links to next and previous arbiters in the contact graph.
00071         struct cpArbiter *next, *prev;
00072 };
00073 
00074 /// A colliding pair of shapes.
00075 struct cpArbiter {
00076         /// Calculated value to use for the elasticity coefficient.
00077         /// Override in a pre-solve collision handler for custom behavior.
00078         cpFloat e;
00079         /// Calculated value to use for the friction coefficient.
00080         /// Override in a pre-solve collision handler for custom behavior.
00081         cpFloat u;
00082          /// Calculated value to use for applying surface velocities.
00083         /// Override in a pre-solve collision handler for custom behavior.
00084         cpVect surface_vr;
00085         
00086         CP_PRIVATE(cpShape *a);
00087         CP_PRIVATE(cpShape *b);
00088         CP_PRIVATE(cpBody *body_a);
00089         CP_PRIVATE(cpBody *body_b);
00090         
00091         CP_PRIVATE(struct cpArbiterThread thread_a);
00092         CP_PRIVATE(struct cpArbiterThread thread_b);
00093         
00094         CP_PRIVATE(int numContacts);
00095         CP_PRIVATE(cpContact *contacts);
00096         
00097         CP_PRIVATE(cpTimestamp stamp);
00098         CP_PRIVATE(cpCollisionHandler *handler);
00099         CP_PRIVATE(cpBool swappedColl);
00100         CP_PRIVATE(cpArbiterState state);
00101 };
00102 
00103 #define CP_DefineArbiterStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00104 static inline type cpArbiterGet##name(const cpArbiter *arb){return arb->member;}
00105 
00106 #define CP_DefineArbiterStructSetter(type, member, name) \
00107 static inline void cpArbiterSet##name(cpArbiter *arb, type value){arb->member = value;}
00108 
00109 #define CP_DefineArbiterStructProperty(type, member, name) \
00110 CP_DefineArbiterStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00111 CP_DefineArbiterStructSetter(type, member, name)
00112 
00113 CP_DefineArbiterStructProperty(cpFloat, e, Elasticity);
00114 CP_DefineArbiterStructProperty(cpFloat, u, Friction);
00115 CP_DefineArbiterStructProperty(cpVect, surface_vr, SurfaceVelocity);
00116 
00117 /// Calculate the total impulse that was applied by this arbiter.
00118 /// Calling this function from a begin or pre-solve callback is undefined.
00119 cpVect cpArbiterTotalImpulse(const cpArbiter *arb);
00120 /// Calculate the total impulse including the friction that was applied by this arbiter.
00121 /// Calling this function from a begin or pre-solve callback is undefined.
00122 cpVect cpArbiterTotalImpulseWithFriction(const cpArbiter *arb);
00123 
00124 /// Causes a collision pair to be ignored as if you returned false from a begin callback.
00125 /// If called from a pre-step callback, you will still need to return false
00126 /// if you want it to be ignored in the current step.
00127 void cpArbiterIgnore(cpArbiter *arb);
00128 
00129 /// Return the colliding shapes involved for this arbiter.
00130 /// The order of their cpSpace.collision_type values will match
00131 /// the order set when the collision handler was registered.
00132 static inline void cpArbiterGetShapes(const cpArbiter *arb, cpShape **a, cpShape **b)
00133 {
00134         if(arb->CP_PRIVATE(swappedColl)){
00135                 (*a) = arb->CP_PRIVATE(b), (*b) = arb->CP_PRIVATE(a);
00136         } else {
00137                 (*a) = arb->CP_PRIVATE(a), (*b) = arb->CP_PRIVATE(b);
00138         }
00139 }
00140 /// A macro shortcut for defining and retrieving the shapes from an arbiter.
00141 #define CP_ARBITER_GET_SHAPES(arb, a, b) cpShape *a, *b; cpArbiterGetShapes(arb, &a, &b);
00142 
00143 /// Return the colliding bodies involved for this arbiter.
00144 /// The order of the cpSpace.collision_type the bodies are associated with values will match
00145 /// the order set when the collision handler was registered.
00146 static inline void cpArbiterGetBodies(const cpArbiter *arb, cpBody **a, cpBody **b)
00147 {
00148         CP_ARBITER_GET_SHAPES(arb, shape_a, shape_b);
00149         (*a) = shape_a->body;
00150         (*b) = shape_b->body;
00151 }
00152 /// A macro shortcut for defining and retrieving the bodies from an arbiter.
00153 #define CP_ARBITER_GET_BODIES(arb, a, b) cpBody *a, *b; cpArbiterGetBodies(arb, &a, &b);
00154 
00155 /// Returns true if this is the first step a pair of objects started colliding.
00156 static inline cpBool cpArbiterIsFirstContact(const cpArbiter *arb)
00157 {
00158         return arb->CP_PRIVATE(state) == cpArbiterStateFirstColl;
00159 }
00160 
00161 /// Get the number of contact points for this arbiter.
00162 static inline int cpArbiterGetCount(const cpArbiter *arb)
00163 {
00164         return arb->CP_PRIVATE(numContacts);
00165 }
00166 
00167 /// A struct that wraps up the important collision data for an arbiter.
00168 typedef struct cpContactPointSet {
00169         /// The number of contact points in the set.
00170         int count;
00171         
00172         /// The array of contact points.
00173         struct {
00174                 /// The position of the contact point.
00175                 cpVect point;
00176                 /// The normal of the contact point.
00177                 cpVect normal;
00178                 /// The depth of the contact point.
00179                 cpFloat dist;
00180         } points[CP_MAX_CONTACTS_PER_ARBITER];
00181 } cpContactPointSet;
00182 /// Return a contact set from an arbiter.
00183 cpContactPointSet cpArbiterGetContactPointSet(const cpArbiter *arb);
00184 
00185 /// Get the normal of the @c ith contact point.
00186 cpVect cpArbiterGetNormal(const cpArbiter *arb, int i);
00187 /// Get the position of the @c ith contact point.
00188 cpVect cpArbiterGetPoint(const cpArbiter *arb, int i);
00189 /// Get the depth of the @c ith contact point.
00190 cpFloat cpArbiterGetDepth(const cpArbiter *arb, int i);
00191 
00192 /// @}
